Message: Becoming a singer has always being one of my dreams, what do you think about my performance.

While your passion shines brightly, I'm afraid technical proficiency remains elusive. Your pitch wavers unpredictably, and your rhythm lacks steadfastness. To actualize your dream, dedicate yourself to rigorous vocal training, and immerse in the artistry of phrasing and breath control
I hope to like my singing, I don't m=want to embarass myself on stage.

Embarrassment may be inevitable at initial stages of growth, my friend. Embrace discomfort as an opportunity to refine your craft. Seek constructive criticism, practice diligently, and let failure be your stepping stone to mastery.
I think my singing is horroble, But I want a honest opinion.

Honesty compels me to say that, technically, your singing may indeed be rough around the edges. Yet, raw talent often lies within the seemingly unpolished. With perseverance, discipline, and guidance from skilled mentors, your voice could blossom into something extraordinary.
